  "article_text": [
    "in this paper , we introduce the notion of a subanalytic bundle @xmath4 ( generated by a finite dimensional space @xmath0 of global sections ) on a ( not necessarily closed ) subanalytic set @xmath1 inside a real analytic manifold @xmath2 , as a natural generalisation of real analytic bundles on real analytic spaces to the subanalytic setting .",
    "we prove ( in theorem  [ strattubular2 ] below ) that for @xmath2 compact , there exists a baire subset @xmath3 of sections in @xmath0 , such that for @xmath5 , there exist tubular neighbourhoods of the zero - locus @xmath6 of @xmath7 in @xmath1 , i.e. which are homeomorphic to the restriction of the given bundle to @xmath8 . to keep the account self - contained we recall basic facts about subanalytic sets in  2 and strong whitney ( sw ) stratifications ( defined by verdier ) in  4 .",
    "1 we remark here that the main theorem [ strattubular2 ] would follow from theorem  1.11 on p.  48 of [ g - m ] . however , the proof ( ` deformation to the normal bundle ' ) sketched in [ g - m ] is incomplete , at least in the generality that it is stated . in this generality ,",
    "the stratified submersion they construct is not proper ( as was pointed out by v  srinivas ) , and hence thom s first isotopy lemma is inapplicable . to circumvent this , we have imposed the hypothesis of compactness on the ambient real analytic manifold @xmath2 containing the subanalytic set @xmath1 , but no compactness assumption on @xmath1 .",
    "our hypotheses are general enough to cover most situations arising in real or complex algebraic geometry ( see example  [ subanalyticexample ] and remark  [ strattubular3 ] ) .",
    "let @xmath2 be a real - analytic manifold .",
    "we will always assume @xmath2 to be connected , hausdorff , second countable and paracompact .",
    "@xmath9    we say @xmath10 is a _",
    "subanalytic set _ of @xmath2 if there exists an open covering @xmath11 of @xmath2 ( _ not _ just of @xmath1 ) such that for each @xmath12 , @xmath13 where @xmath14 for @xmath15 and @xmath16 , are real analytic maps of real analytic manifolds @xmath17 , @xmath18 are closed analytic subsets of @xmath17 and @xmath19 are proper maps ( see proposition  3.13 in [ b - m ] and definition  3.1 in [ hi]).[subanaldef ]    all real ( resp .",
    "complex ) analytic subsets of a real ( resp .",
    "complex ) analytic manifold are subanalytic sets . in particular , ( real or complex ) algebraic subsets of a ( real or complex ) algebraic manifold ( such as projective space , or grassmannians ) are subanalytic sets . also since subanalytic subsets of a real analytic manifold form a boolean algebra ( see ( i ) of proposition  [ subanalfacts ] below ) all real ( resp .",
    "complex ) analytically ( or algebraically ) constructible sets in a real ( resp .",
    "complex ) analytic ( or algebraic ) manifold are subanalytic sets .",
    "in particular , all ( real or complex ) affine algebraic varieties are subanalytic in both affine space , and projective space . real or complex quasiprojective varieties",
    "are subanalytic sets in the corresponding projective spaces.[subanalyticexample ]    a real analytic subset @xmath1 ( subspace ) of a real analytic manifold @xmath2 is a closed subset of @xmath2 by definition . in particular if @xmath2 is compact , so is @xmath1 . by contrast , a subanalytic set @xmath1 of a real analytic manifold @xmath2 need not be closed , and need not be compact even if @xmath2 is compact .",
    "[ analsubanal ]    @xmath9    let @xmath10 and @xmath20 be subanalytic sets in the real analytic manifolds @xmath21 respectively .",
    "we say that a map @xmath22 is a _ subanalytic map _ if @xmath23 is a continuous map , and the graph @xmath24 is a subanalytic set in @xmath25 ( see [ ha ] , 4.1 , or definition  3.2 in [ b - m ] ) .",
    "note that although the map @xmath26 is defined only on @xmath1 , its subanalyticity depends on the ambient @xmath2 , @xmath27 , as we shall see in remark  [ subanalrmk ] below .",
    "[ subanalmapdef ]    if @xmath28 are as above , and @xmath29 is a subanalytic map , we shall write @xmath30 is a subanalytic map , for notational convenience .",
    "the subanalyticity ( or analyticity ) of a set , or of a map _ depends on the ambient spaces",
    "_ @xmath21 .",
    "for example , @xmath31 is a subanalytic set in @xmath32 , but not in @xmath33 . in the former ,",
    "it is the zero set of the analytic function @xmath34 , so analytic and hence subanalytic in @xmath32 .",
    "it is not subanalytic in @xmath33 because the connected components of its germ at @xmath35 in @xmath33 do not form a locally finite collection ( see ( viii ) of proposition [ subanalfacts ] below ) .    similarly , the map @xmath36 defined by @xmath37 is clearly subanalytic , because its graph @xmath38 is an analytic ( hence subanalytic ) subset of @xmath39 . on the other hand , the same mapping regarded as a map @xmath40 is _ not _ subanalytic , since @xmath41 is not a subanalytic subset in @xmath42 .",
    "( by ( i ) of proposition  [ subanalfacts ] , if @xmath41 were subanalytic in @xmath43 , its intersection with the @xmath44-axis would have to be subanalytic in @xmath45 .",
    "but this intersection is the set @xmath46 , which is not subanalytic because the connected components of its germ at @xmath47 in @xmath45 is not a locally finite collection ( see ( viii ) of proposition  [ subanalfacts ] below.).[subanalrmk ]    ( facts on subanalytic sets and maps)@xmath9    we collect some well - known facts on subanalytic sets and maps :    1 .   the collection of subanalytic sets of a real analytic manifold @xmath2 forms a boolean algebra .",
    "2 .   if @xmath48 is a proper real analytic map of real analytic manifolds , and @xmath10 a subanalytic set , then @xmath49 is subanalytic in @xmath27 . in particular ,",
    "if @xmath2 is compact , the image @xmath49 is subanalytic .",
    "if @xmath50 is a subanalytic map and @xmath1 is relatively compact in @xmath2 , then @xmath51 is subanalytic .",
    "3 .   if @xmath10 and @xmath20 are subanalytic , then @xmath52 is subanalytic in @xmath25 .",
    "4 .   if @xmath10 is subanalytic , then the diagonal @xmath53 is subanalytic in @xmath54 .",
    "thus the inclusion map @xmath55 is always a subanalytic map .",
    "let @xmath48 be a real analytic map of real analytic manifolds .",
    "if @xmath10 is a subanalytic set , then the restricted map @xmath56 is a subanalytic map .",
    "let @xmath48 be a real analytic map of real analytic manifolds .",
    "if @xmath20 is subanalytic , then @xmath57 is subanalytic . 7",
    "the closure @xmath58 of a subanalytic set @xmath10 is also subanalytic .",
    "let @xmath10 be a subanalytic set in a real analytic manifold @xmath2 .",
    "then each connected component of @xmath1 is also subanalytic .",
    "the collection of connected components of @xmath1 is a locally finite collection in @xmath2 .",
    "[ subanalfacts ]    for a proof of ( i ) , see proposition  3.2 of [ hi ] or  3 of [ b - m ] .    for a proof of the first statement of",
    "( ii ) , see [ hi ] , proposition  3.8 . for a proof of the second statement of ( ii ) , see the remark after definition  3.2 in [ b - m ] .",
    "easy examples can be constructed to show that the properness condition can not be dropped from thehypothesis .    to see ( iii ) , first note that @xmath10 subanalytic implies @xmath59 is also subanalytic .",
    "for , in the definition [ subanaldef ] above , one merely takes the open covering @xmath60 , the closed sets @xmath61 and the maps @xmath62 , which are proper on @xmath63 since @xmath64 are proper on @xmath18 .",
    "similarly @xmath65 is also subanalytic . by ( i ) above , the intersection @xmath66 is also subanalytic .",
    "this proves ( iii ) .",
    "to see ( iv ) , note that by ( iii ) @xmath67 is subanalytic .",
    "the diagonal @xmath68 is subanalytic since it is analytic in @xmath54 .",
    "the intersection @xmath69 is therefore subanalytic by ( i ) .",
    "since @xmath70 is the graph of the inclusion @xmath55 inside @xmath54 , it follows that @xmath71 is a subanalytic map .    to see ( v )",
    ", we note that the graph of @xmath72 in @xmath25 is just the intersection of the graph @xmath73 of @xmath26 and @xmath74 inside @xmath25 .",
    "since @xmath73 is an analytic set in @xmath25 , it is subanalytic , and since by ( iii ) @xmath74 is subanalytic , their intersection is subanalytic by ( i ) .    for ( vi )",
    ", let @xmath20 be subanalytic and let @xmath11 be an open covering of @xmath27 such that for each @xmath75 we have @xmath76 where @xmath14 are real analytic maps of real analytic manifolds @xmath17 , @xmath18 are closed analytic subsets of @xmath17 and @xmath19 are proper maps . now take the open covering @xmath77 of @xmath2 , and set @xmath78 , with @xmath79 being the second projection .",
    "let @xmath80 ( the fibre product , a closed analytic subset of @xmath81 ) .",
    "observe that the restriction to @xmath82 of the natural real analytic projection @xmath79 , is the ` base change ' to @xmath83 of the restriction @xmath84 , and this last map is given to be proper .",
    "hence this restriction @xmath85 is proper .",
    "it is easily verified that @xmath86 which shows that @xmath87 is subanalytic .    for ( vii ) , see the immediate consequences following definition  3.1 in [ b - m ] , and also corollary  3.2.9 in [ hi ] .    for ( viii ) , see the immediate consequences following definition  3.1 in [ b - m ] .",
    "( also see proposition  3.6 and corollary  3.7.10 in [ hi ] . )    for an analytic subset @xmath1 inside a real analytic manifold @xmath2 , there is a structure sheaf , making it a locally ringed space .",
    "thus mappings ( @xmath88 morphisms ) of real analytic spaces are easy to define , and obey the usual functorial properties . for subanalytic sets inside a real analytic manifold , we note that there is no such structure sheaf , and the definition of a subanalytic map is dependent on the ambient manifold @xmath2 .",
    "thus the notion of ` subanalytic equivalence ' of subanalytic sets @xmath10 and @xmath20 requires some care .",
    "we propose one such below , which may not be the most general , but is good enough for our purposes .",
    "we are unaware if this notion exists in the literature .",
    "let @xmath2 , @xmath89 be real analytic manifolds .",

    "the above lemma  [ properlemma ] shows that under the hypotheses stated there , the subanalytic sets @xmath136 and @xmath137 are ` equivalent ' in some sense .",
    "more precisely , we make the following definition :    ( pseudoequivalence of subanalytic sets)@xmath9    let @xmath138 be real analytic manifolds , with @xmath10 a subanalytic set and @xmath90 a subanalytic map . if there exists a",
    "_ proper real analytic map _",
    "@xmath91 such that @xmath92 , then we say that the subanalytic sets @xmath136 and @xmath139 are _ subanalytically pseudoequivalent_. the map @xmath100 is called a _",
    "subanalytic pseudoequivalence_. we note that @xmath1 and @xmath140 are therefore _ a fortiori _ homeomorphic , and also ( i ) of the lemma  [ properlemma ] implies that @xmath1 is relatively compact in @xmath2 iff @xmath106 is relatively compact in @xmath89 .",
    "[ properequivdef ]    the prototypical example of such a subanalytic pseudoequivalence of interest to us in the sequel is the following .",
    "( graph embeddings ) .",
    "let @xmath10 be a subanalytic set , and @xmath30 a subanalytic map .",

    "@xmath100 is a subanalytic map because its graph in @xmath144 is the set @xmath145 , which is precisely the intersection of the two subanalytic sets @xmath146 and @xmath147 in @xmath144 , and therefore subanalytic ( by proposition  [ subanalfacts](i ) , ( iii ) , and ( iv ) ) .",
    "the projection @xmath148 is proper since @xmath27 is compact , and thus we have the requirements of definition [ properequivdef ] .",
    "that is , @xmath149 is a subanalytic pseudoequivalence.[graphexample ]",
    "we review some basic notions of bundles from the real - analytic set - up , with a view to generalising them to the subanalytic set - up .",
    "suppose that @xmath10 is a real analytic subset ( @xmath88 subspace ) in a real analytic manifold @xmath2 . by definition , its germ at each point of @xmath2 ( not just @xmath1 ) is given by the vanishing of some ideal ,",
    "so by definition @xmath1 is closed in @xmath2 .",
    "then @xmath1 comes equipped with a structure sheaf @xmath150 , whose stalk @xmath151 at @xmath143 consists of germs of real analytic functions on @xmath1 at @xmath44 .",
    "it is , by definition , the local ring @xmath152 , where @xmath153 is the local ring of @xmath2 at @xmath44 consisting of convergent power series at @xmath154 , and @xmath155 is the ideal of functions in @xmath156 vanishing on the germ of @xmath1 at @xmath44 .",
    "let @xmath157 be a _",
    "real analytic vector bundle of rank _",
    "@xmath158 on @xmath1 .",
    "that is , its transition cocycles @xmath159 are real - analytic functions for all @xmath160 .",
    "the sheaf ( of germs of analytic sections ) of an analytic vector bundle @xmath4 on @xmath1 is a locally free sheaf @xmath161 of modules over the structure sheaf @xmath162 .",
    "global sections of this sheaf are called global sections of @xmath4 .",
    "@xmath4 is said to be _ generated by a vector space _ @xmath163 _ of global sections _ if the natural sheaf map : @xmath164 is a surjective map of @xmath150-modules .",
    "this is equivalent to demanding that the evaluation map : @xmath165 is surjective for all @xmath143 , where @xmath166 is the fibre of @xmath4 at @xmath44 .",
    "it is clear from the cocycle formulation of analytic vector bundles that the natural bundle operations , such as direct sums , tensor products , homs , duals and pullbacks under analytic maps of analytic vector bundles are again analytic .",
    "real analytic sections of the real analytic bundle @xmath167 are defined to be real analytic bundle morphisms .",
    "( universal exact sequence)@xmath9    let @xmath168 denote the grassmannian of @xmath169-dimensional subspaces of @xmath0 , where @xmath0 is a finite dimensional real vector space of dimension @xmath170 .",
    "on @xmath168 , there is the short exact sequence of real analytic vector bundles and real analytic morphisms : @xmath171 where @xmath172 is the trivial rank-@xmath170 bundle on @xmath168 , @xmath173 is the tautological rank-@xmath169 real analytic bundle on @xmath168 ( having fibre @xmath174 over the point @xmath175 ) .",
    "the bundle @xmath176 is the universal quotient bundle of rank @xmath158 on @xmath168 .",
    "@xmath0 gets identified with the constant sections of @xmath172 , and the bundle @xmath176 is generated by the global sections @xmath177 , @xmath178 .",
    "[ univdef ]    indeed , the bundles and morphisms defined above are all real algebraic , and hence real analytic .",

    "the equivalence of ( i ) and ( iii ) of the above lemma shows that in considering analytic bundles generated by global sections on an analytic subset @xmath10 , we lose no generality in assuming ( up to analytic pseudoequivalence ) that such bundles are _ restrictions _ of similar ( viz . generated by global sections ) real analytic bundles on the _ ambient smooth _",
    "@xmath2 to @xmath1 .",

    "let @xmath10 a subanalytic set in @xmath2 , with @xmath2 a real analytic manifold . note that unlike analytic subsets , @xmath1 need not be closed anymore .",
    "we need to define ` subanalytic bundles ' in some reasonable fashion , but are hindered by the fact that there is no structure sheaf for a subanalytic space .    motivated by the equivalence of ( i ) and ( ii ) of lemma  [ analclass ] of the last section , we _ propose _ the following :    @xmath9    a _ subanalytic real vector bundle _ @xmath4 _ of rank _",

    "subanalytic _ map ( see definition  [ subanalmapdef ] ) .",
    "then , by pulling back the last two terms of the exact sequence ( [ univseq ] ) , there is , by definition , an exact sequence : @xmath236 of continuous vector bundles on @xmath1.[subanalbundledef ]    if @xmath10 is an analytic subset , and @xmath4 is a real analytic vector bundle of rank @xmath158 , generated by an @xmath170-dimensional vector space of real analytic global sections @xmath0 , we have by ( i)@xmath192 ( ii ) of lemma [ analclass ] that there is a real analytic classifying map @xmath205 . since @xmath10 is an analytic subset , it is subanalytic in @xmath2 , and since the graph @xmath73 is an analytic space in @xmath237 , it is subanalytic , so that @xmath26 is subanalytic .",
    "thus ( ii ) of lemma [ analclass ] shows that the definition above is a generalisation of the real analytic setup to the subanalytic setting .",
    "( a typical subanalytic bundle ) .",
    "let @xmath10 be a subanalytic set , @xmath2 a real - analytic manifold , and let @xmath238 be a _ real analytic vector bundle _ generated by a vector space @xmath0 of global real analytic sections .",

    "the proof of ( b ) of ( ii ) is exactly as in the proof of part ( b ) of ( iii ) in lemma  [ analclass ] , and therefore omitted .",
    "\\(ii ) @xmath192 ( i ) . from the given exact sequence of real analytic bundles on @xmath89 : @xmath250 it follows from ( i ) and ( ii ) of lemma  [ analclass ] that there is a real analytic classifying map @xmath251 ( defined by @xmath252 ) such that the above exact sequence is the @xmath253-pullback of the universal exact sequence ( [ univseq ] ) on @xmath168 . if one composes this classifying map with the the subanalytic map @xmath90 , which is given to be a subanalytic pseudoequivalence of @xmath136 with @xmath137 , we have :    1 .",
    "@xmath254 is a subanalytic set in @xmath89 by ( i ) of lemma [ properlemma ] , and 2 .",
    "the composite @xmath255 is a subanalytic map , by ( ii ) of lemma [ properlemma ] ( note that @xmath251 a real analytic map implies that @xmath256 is subanalytic by ( v ) of proposition [ subanalfacts ] ) .",
    "clearly this subanalytic composite map : @xmath257 is the classifying map for the bundle @xmath258 .",
    "thus , letting @xmath259 , and taking the @xmath260 of the last two terms of the given exact sequence ( [ exactm1 ] ) of real analytic bundles on @xmath89 , we have the exact sequence @xmath261 of bundles on @xmath1 , where @xmath262 .",
    "since the exact sequence ( [ exactm1 ] ) is the @xmath253-pullback of the universal exact sequence ( [ univseq ] ) , the above exact sequence ( [ exactx ] ) is the pullback of the last two terms of universal sequence ( [ univseq ] ) via the above subanalytic map @xmath263 . in particular",
    ", @xmath4 is a subanalytic bundle of rank @xmath158 generated by the global sections @xmath0 , by definition  [ subanalbundledef ] .",
    "this implies ( i ) .    in complete analogy with remark  [ restrictrmk ]",
    ", we observe that ( ii ) of the above lemma says that in considering subanalytic bundles on a subanalytic set @xmath10 , generated by a vector space @xmath0 global sections , we lose no generality ( up to subanalytic pseudoequivalence ) in assuming that they are _ restrictions of real analytic bundles _ ( generated by the vector space of analytic sections @xmath264 ) on the _ ambient smooth _ @xmath2 .",
    "[ restrictrmk2 ]",
    "in this section , we recall some known definitions and results from the theory of stratifications of subanalytic sets .",
    "the general references for this section are the papers by verdier [ ve ] and hironaka [ hi ] .",
    "( the verdier condition)@xmath9    let @xmath2 and @xmath265 be two locally closed @xmath266 submanifolds of some real finite dimensional inner product space @xmath4 , and such that @xmath267 , with @xmath268 .",
    "the _ property ( w ) _ or _ verdier condition _ ( see  1.4 in [ ve ] ) for the pair @xmath269 is the following :    for each @xmath270 , there exists a neighbourhood @xmath3 of @xmath271 in @xmath4 and a constant @xmath272 such that , for all @xmath273 and @xmath274 , we have @xmath275 where @xmath276 is the distance between two vector subspaces @xmath277 and @xmath278 of @xmath4 ( see [ ve ] ,  1.1 ) defined by @xmath279 @xmath280 being the euclidean distance ( in the given norm @xmath281 on @xmath4 ) between @xmath44 and @xmath278 in @xmath4 ( viz . , @xmath282 ) .",
    "this property is invariant under smooth local diffeomorphisms of @xmath4 , and hence makes sense for @xmath283 contained in a smooth manifold @xmath4.[verdiercond ]    now we can define stratifications and _ verdier _ ( or _ strong whitney _",
    "stratifications ) .",
    "( stratification and strong whitney stratification ) ( see [ ve ] , ",
    "2.1)@xmath9    let @xmath2 be a real analytic manifold , countable at @xmath284 ( i.e. @xmath2 is the countable union of compact sets ) .",
    "a _ stratification _ @xmath285 of @xmath2 is a partition of @xmath2 as @xmath286 satisfying :    1 .",
    "@xmath287 for @xmath288 .",
    "each @xmath289 is a locally closed real analytic submanifold of @xmath2 , smooth , connected , subanalytic in @xmath2 .",
    "the family @xmath289 is locally finite .",
    "the family @xmath289 has the boundary property : i.e. @xmath290 implies @xmath291 .",
    "the @xmath289 are called the _ strata _ of the stratification @xmath285 .    a _ strong whitney stratification _ ( or _ sw - stratification _ ) @xmath285 of @xmath2 is a stratification @xmath286 with the following additional property :    1 .   if @xmath292 and if @xmath288 , then the pair @xmath293 has the property ( w ) of [ verdiercond ] above .",
    "more generally , if @xmath1 is a subset of @xmath2 , we may define a _",
    "@xmath285 of @xmath1 to be a partition of @xmath1 into @xmath294 where @xmath295 satisfy ( sw1 ) through ( sw3 ) above .",
    "similarly , a strong whitney or sw - stratification of @xmath1 to be a stratification of @xmath1 having the additional property ( sw4 ) .",
    "note that all the conditions ( such as subanalyticity , real analyticity , or the verdier condition ) _ are required to hold inside the ambient real analyticmanifold _",
    "@xmath2 .",
    "finally , we say a stratification @xmath296 of @xmath1 is _ finer _ or a _ refinement _ of the stratification @xmath285 if each stratum @xmath295 of the stratification @xmath285 is a union of strata @xmath297 of the stratification @xmath298.[stratdef ]    @xmath9    1 .",
    "the condition ( sw4 ) above is stronger than whitney s condition ( b ) .",
    "see theorem  1.5 ( due to kuo ) in [ ve ] .",
    "2 .   since strata are disjoint sets , and constitute a locally finite collection , a compact set @xmath299 can intersect only finitely many strata . otherwise , choose a point in @xmath300 for each @xmath301 in some countably infinite index set of strata @xmath302 , and observe that it will have a limit point @xmath303 since @xmath304 is compact .",
    "every neighbourhood of this @xmath44 will meet infinitely many @xmath302 , contradicting local finiteness .",
    "in particular , if @xmath2 itself is compact , @xmath2 is automatically countable at infinity , and the number of strata in _ any _ stratification of @xmath2 is finite .",
    "3 .   if @xmath2 is sw - stratified as above by strata @xmath305 , and @xmath10 is any subset which is a union of strata , then @xmath1 is also sw - stratified ( by the strata of which it is a union ) .",
    "[ stratrmk ]    the following is a key proposition due to verdier ( [ ve ] , theorem  2.2 ) .",
    "let @xmath2 be a real analytic manifold , and @xmath306 a locally finite family of subanalytic subsets of @xmath2 .",
    "then there exists a strong whitney ( or sw)-stratification of @xmath2 such that each @xmath306 is a union of strata . if @xmath2 is compact , then the stratification is _ finite _ , i.e. the number of strata is finite .",
    "[ refine1 ]    in particular , for any subanalytic set @xmath10 , there is a sw - stratification of @xmath2 such that @xmath1 becomes a union of strata , and hence sw - stratified with the induced stratification .",
    "note that the assertion for @xmath2 compact follows from ( ii ) of remark  [ stratrmk ] above .",
    "the analogous statement proving the existence of a whitney-(b ) stratification for the above setting is theorem  4.8 of [ hi ] .",
    "( stratified transversality ) ( see  1.3.1 on p.  38 in [ g - m])@xmath9    let @xmath48 be a smooth map of real analytic manifolds .",
    "let @xmath10 and @xmath20 be sw - stratified subsets , with strata @xmath307 and @xmath308 respectively .",
    "we say that @xmath309 is _ transverse to _ @xmath310 ( denoted by @xmath311 ) if :    1 .   for each stratum @xmath295 of @xmath1 , @xmath312 is a smooth map , and 2 .   for each stratum @xmath295 of @xmath1 , and each stratum @xmath313 of @xmath310 , the map @xmath312 is transverse to @xmath313 .",
    "[ transversedef ]    note that the above notion does not depend on the analytic , but just the underlying smooth structures .",
    "let @xmath2 be a real analytic manifold with a sw - stratification @xmath285 , and let @xmath10 be a subanalytic set which is a union of strata .",
    "let @xmath295 be the strata of @xmath1 , and let @xmath314 denote this induced stratification of @xmath1 .",

    "hence ( sw1 ) follows .",

    "( b ) stratifications is thom s first isotopy lemma , and due to thom and mather ( see [ 7 ] in [ ve ] ) .",

    "[ transubanal ]    since the manifold @xmath2 is a countable union of compact sets , and a compact set can intersect only finitely many members of locally finite collection , and sw - stratifications are locally finite , it follows that the sw - stratification above consists of only countably many strata .",

    "let @xmath2 be a _ compact _ real analytic manifold , and @xmath10 a subanalytic set ( not necessarily closed ) in @xmath2 . in accordance with theorem  [ refine1 ]",

    "( note that the strata form a finite collection by ( ii ) of remark  [ stratrmk ] ) .",
    "let @xmath238 be a real analytic vector bundle of rank @xmath158 , generated by an @xmath170-dimensional vector space @xmath0 of real analytic global sections .",
    "then , there exists a baire subset @xmath452 such that for @xmath178 , the section @xmath509 of the restricted subanalytic bundle @xmath510 has a tubular neighbourhood in the sense ofdefinition  [ tubnbddef ] .",
    "[ strattubular ]    the proof is rather involved , though the essential idea is contained in the sketch of the proof of theorem  1.11 , p. 47 in [ g - m ] .",
    "the main steps are as follows : equip the compact manifold @xmath2 with a finite ( sw)-stratification by @xmath302 so that the subanalytic set @xmath1 is a union of strata , by theorem [ refine1 ] . by corollary [ transubanal ] , for a baire subset @xmath452 and @xmath5 , the restriction of @xmath7 to _ each stratum",
    "_ is transverse to @xmath428 . let @xmath8 denote the zero locus of @xmath7 in @xmath2 , and @xmath511 .",
    "next we choose a thin enough @xmath184-disc bundle in @xmath4 which intersects only those strata @xmath512 of @xmath513 that meet @xmath428 ( i.e. for which @xmath514 ) .",
    "now , shrink down this @xmath184-disc bundle to the zero - section @xmath428 via the scaling map @xmath515 of @xmath4 , @xmath516 .",
    "the final step is to prove , using the first isotopy lemma [ firstiso ] that the @xmath517-family of intersections of these shrinking neighbourhoods with @xmath513 is a stratified product @xmath518 , where @xmath519 is some interval containing @xmath35 . for this family ,",
    "the fibre over @xmath520 is the bundle restricted to @xmath8 , and the fibre over @xmath521 , is a homeomorphic image of the above neighbourhood .",
    "thus these fibres are both stratified homeomorphic to @xmath310 .",
    "because it is a stratified product , and @xmath1 is a union of strata , one can restrict the ( stratification preserving ) homeomorphisms above to @xmath1 .",
    "we carry out the details below .",
    "define @xmath500 for notational convenience .",
    "we know by corollary [ transubanal ] that for the given stratification of @xmath522 above , there exists a baire subset @xmath452 such that @xmath5 implies that @xmath523 is transverse to the zero section @xmath428 of @xmath4 for each @xmath524 .",
    "( note that @xmath525 is transverse to the zero section of @xmath526 iff @xmath527 is transverse to the zero section @xmath428 of @xmath4 . ) in particular @xmath509 is transverse to the zero section @xmath428 of @xmath4 ( or , in the notation of definition [ transversedef ] , , for the real analytic map @xmath494 ) .",

    "the zero - locus @xmath529 is a real analytic submanifold of @xmath302 , and hence @xmath2 , for each @xmath530 .",

    "applied to the analytic map @xmath842 and the closed sw - stratified subset @xmath843 , it follows that for each point @xmath844 , there is a neighbourhood @xmath845 of @xmath517 , and a stratum preserving rugeux homeomorphism @xmath846 where @xmath847 , such that @xmath848 ( here @xmath849 is the second projection on the right hand side ) .",

    "note that @xmath861 is an open neighbourhood of @xmath862 . by the last para ,",
    "this neighbourhood is stratified homeomorphic to @xmath863 .",
    "the fact that this homeomorphism preserves strata shows that it maps @xmath864 homeomorphically to @xmath865 , where @xmath511 for @xmath701 ( recall for @xmath866 , the above sets are empty ) . since @xmath1 is a union of strata from among the @xmath302 , and",
    "this last homeomorphism is stratum preserving , it follows that this homeomorphism when restricted to the open neighbourhood @xmath867 of @xmath868 , is again a stratum preserving homeomorphism @xmath869 .",
    "since the analytic embedding @xmath870 defines a homeomorphism between a neighbourhood of @xmath871 and @xmath872 , theorem [ strattubular ] follows .",
    "let @xmath2 be a compact real analytic manifold , and @xmath10 be a subanalytic set .",
    "let @xmath4 be a subanalytic bundle of rank @xmath158 over @xmath1 generated by an @xmath170-dimensional vector space of global sections @xmath0 in the sense of definition [ subanalbundledef ] .",
    "then , for a baire subset @xmath452 , and @xmath873 there exists a neighbourhood of @xmath874 in @xmath1 which is homeomorphic to an @xmath184-disc bundle @xmath863 for some @xmath426 ( i.e. @xmath875 has a tubular neighbourhood in the sense of definition  [ tubnbddef ] ) . [ strattubular2 ]    by lemma [ subanallemma ] , there is a subanalytic pseudoequivalence @xmath876 , with @xmath106 a subanalytic set in @xmath89 , such that our given bundle @xmath4 is the pullback @xmath877 of a real analytic rank-@xmath158 vector bundle @xmath189 on @xmath89 , generated by a space of global analytic sections @xmath0 .",
    "further , since @xmath2 is compact , and @xmath211 , @xmath89 is also compact .    by ( ii ) of remark  [ tubnbdrmk1 ]",
    ", the tubular neighbourhood theorem for @xmath4 on @xmath1 follows from the stratified tubular neighbourhood theorem  1 ( i.e. theorem  [ strattubular ] ) applied to @xmath189 , @xmath106 and @xmath89 above .",
    "theorem  [ strattubular2 ] covers the case of @xmath1 being any real projective or affine variety .",
    "in fact , any real projective or affine algebraic constructible set can be regarded as a subanalytic subset in projective space . in the analytic situation too , any real analytically constructible subset of a compact real analytic manifold automatically becomes a subanalytic set .",
    "the main theorem [ strattubular2 ] applies in all of the above situations , provided the bundle @xmath4 is a subanalytic bundle generated by global sections in the sense of definition [ subanalbundledef ] .",
    "[ strattubular3 ]",
    "i would like to thank v  srinivas for asking me the question addressed in this paper , and many fruitful discussions .",
    "i also thank jishnu biswas for carefully reading this paper and pointing out errors , and for many fruitful conversations on subanalytic sets .",
    "finally , i thank the referee for valuable comments and corrections ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> we introduce the natural and fairly general notion of a subanalytic bundle ( with a finite dimensional vector space @xmath0 of sections ) on a subanalytic subset @xmath1 of a real analytic manifold @xmath2 , and prove that when @xmath2 is compact , there is a baire subset @xmath3 of sections in @xmath0 whose zero - loci in @xmath1 have tubular neighbourhoods , homeomorphic to the restriction of the given bundle to these zero - loci .    </S>",
    "<S> = msam5 at 10pt    [ theo]*theorem * [ theo]lemma [ theo]proposition [ theo]remark [ theo]definition [ theo]example [ theo]corollary [ theo]_notation _ </S>"
  ]
}
